column4: hi, I'm a little lost, just trying to install java Run time environment on Ubuntu 9.10...  followed instructions on this link.. http://www.java.com/en/download/manual.jsp  anyone have any input
- in terminal run: sudo apt-get install sun-java6-plugin
- in terminal run: sudo apt-get install sun-java6-plugin
:Package sun-java6-plugin is not available, but is referred to by another package
- maybe I know I always have medibuntu added on my systems (first thing I always do) so it might be in there
fyi - this is reason number 326 I suggest Mint over Ubuntu :)
all right how do I go about doing that?
all right I added the repos... what now? should I see more java options in the package manager? I dont
- guis are for people who have time to waste ;)
The following packages have unmet dependencies:  sun-java6-plugin: Depends: sun-java6-bin (= 6-15-1) but 6-16-0ubuntu1.9.04 is to be installed
- try this: sudo apt-get purge sun-java6* && sudo apt-get install sun-java6-plugin
- very good. That should do the trick
I can't press the <Ok> button on the terminal based installation prompt...
Setting up sun-java6-plugin (6-15-1) ... so I guess it is done? now I have 6-15-1? now I can install 6-16-1?
- it should be all installed. Try the online java check
